Description: Body sherd of one 'leg' of Aeolian grey ware pottery open-work tripod stand; flaring out at lower end; exterior, worn dark grey slip; decoration in relief consisting of three vertical ribs at the sides and centre of the sherd; interior roughly finished.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to same stand as British Museum 1888,0601.645.a plus 1996,0101.1, but does not join (see Lamb's photo, 1932, pl.3,1). Gardner 1888, 47, mentions grey-wares being common finds in the sanctuary of Aphrodite, including "tripods and other ornamental pieces, with relief ornamentation". It therefore is likely that the fragment was found in the sanctuary of Aphrodite. Lamb 1932, 8-9, fig. 3.7, notes parallels for stands with plastic mouldings around the base (and/or top?) from Methymna on Lesbos.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.162)
